messages.content: Create a new file at /tmp/gemini-test/created.txt with the content 'Hello from Gemini CLI'

toolCalls.name: write_file

response.output: Successfully created and wrote to new file: /tmp/gemini-test/created.txt.

toolCalls.description:
Writes content to a specified file in the local filesystem.

      The user has the ability to modify `content`. If modified, this will be stated in the response.

thoughts.subject: Evaluating File Creation Method
thoughts.description: I'm zeroing in on the file creation. Considering the user's requirements, the `write_file` tool seems like the perfect fit. I've got the path and content locked and loaded. The next step is to execute the tool call!

thoughts.subject: Finalizing Tool Parameters
thoughts.description: I'm ready to move forward. The file path and content are set. I've confirmed that the `write_file` tool is ideal and have prepped the arguments. I'm confident that the file, containing "Hello from Gemini CLI", will be created at `/tmp/gemini-test/created.txt`. I'm ready for the call.
